extendedIngredients.name: condensed cream of chicken soup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (103/4 oz) condensed cream of chicken soup

extendedIngredients.name: mixed vegetables
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 bags (12 oz each) frozen mixed vegetables, thawed

extendedIngredients.name: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (8 oz) refrigerated crescent dinner rolls

recipes.title: Crescent Chicken Pot Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: 1                               Heat oven to 400F. Spray 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish with cooking spray.                                                          2                               Spray 10-inch skillet with cooking spray. Heat over medium heat. Add onion; cook 3 minutes. Stir in garlic, thyme, salt and pepper; cook 2 minutes longer or until onion is tender.                                                          3                               In large bowl, mix onion mixture, soup, sour cream, chicken and vegetables. Spoon into baking dish.                                                          4                               On lightly floured surface, unroll dough into 1 long 13x9-inch rectangle; firmly press perforations and edges to seal. Place dough over filling. Fold over edges to fit inside casserole. Cut small slits in top of dough.                                                          5                               Bake 20 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown and filling is bubbly.

steps.step: Heat oven to 400F. Spray 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish with cooking spray.
Add onion; cook 3 minutes. Stir in garlic, thyme, salt and pepper; cook 2 minutes longer or until onion is tender.
In large bowl, mix onion mixture, soup, sour cream, chicken and vegetables. Spoon into baking dish.
On lightly floured surface, unroll dough into 1 long 13x9-inch rectangle; firmly press perforations and edges to seal.
Place dough over filling. Fold over edges to fit inside casserole.
Cut small slits in top of dough.
Bake 20 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown and filling is bubbly.
